intro: Kunthia xalapensis, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to red composite flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Kunthia xalapensis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
